com.itko.lisa.coordinator

Interface TestCoordinator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Coordinator, com.itko.lisa.net.LisaServerObject, com.itko.util.MonitoredObject, com.itko.lisa.coordinator.SyncPointSupport

    public interface TestCoordinator
extends Coordinator
    This is the sub interface to Coordinator that specifically works with staged tests. There's a sibling to this interface for staging suites that also implements Coordinator.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.itko.lisa.coordinator.Coordinator

        AUTO_SIMULATOR, LOCAL_SIMULATOR, STATUS_ENDED, STATUS_INIT, STATUS_NOINIT, STATUS_RUNNING

    • Method Detail

      • getTestCase

        TestCase getTestCase()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Want to see the actual test that's staged by this Coordinator? Modifying it won't do anything to the running test.
        Returns:
        the TestCase object of the test that will be or is running
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setThinking

        void setThinking(int thinking)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This is how we throttle to thinking time from 0% (don't honor think time) to whatever % you wish. For example, passing 100 gives you the exact think time calculated by the step, but 200 gives you double that.
        Parameters:
        thinking - - percent of think time to honor, or 0 not to honor it at all
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setPaceInMillis

        void setPaceInMillis(long millis)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        If you want this coordinator to introduce artificial delay into restarting a test instance to meet a certain pace, provide that pace here. You'll get the test to start waiting to make sure we don't go faster than that pace
        Parameters:
        millis - - < 1 means run full speed, and >=1 means we slow down if needed
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getPaceInMillis

        long getPaceInMillis()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the pace we are currently running with
        Returns:
        the pace in seconds, or 0 if we are not pacing (won't introduce any delay)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getTestRunHistory

        com.itko.lisa.history.TestRunHistory getTestRunHistory()
                                                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        We need this from time to time. It's keeping up with all kinds of good historical data
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getSimulators

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.itko.lisa.simulator.Simulator> getSimulators()
                                                                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Used to retrieve the set of Simulators that are participating in the test.
        Returns:
        Map of the Simulators (a clone), which has for each a name and a reference to their com.itko.lisa.simulator.Simulator interface
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        See Also:
        Simulator

      • addSimulator

        void addSimulator(java.lang.String simName,
                int instances)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         LisaException
        This method provides a means for you to add a simulator to the existing list of simulators executing a test. You can add simulators at any time. Simulators that are added after the test has already started running will be started immediately. Simulators added before the test is started will start in concert with all other simulators.
        Parameters:
        simName - - the network name of the simulator to add
        instances - - the number of concurrent test executions you want on this siumulator
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestRunException - when there is an error or licensing issue with staging to the Simulator
        LisaException
        See Also:
        Simulator

      • addSimulator

        void addSimulator(java.lang.String simName,
                int instances,
                int cycles)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         LisaException
        This method provides a means for you to add a simulator to the existing list of simulators executing a test. You can add simulators at any time. Simulators that are added after the test has already started running will be started immediately. Simulators added before the test is started will start in concert with all other simulators.
        Parameters:
        simName - - the network name of the simulator to add
        instances - - the number of concurrent test executions you want on this siumulator
        cycles - - the number of times to run the test, or 0 to restart indefinitely
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestRunException - when there is an error or licensing issue with staging to the Simulator
        LisaException
        See Also:
        Simulator

      • addInstancesToSimulator

        int addInstancesToSimulator(java.lang.String simName,
                          int newInstances)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                   TestRunException
        This is how you can change the number of instances currently running a test before or during execution.
        Parameters:
        simName - is the network name of the simulator you want changed
        newInstances - is the delta of instances you want. For example, a positive 10 would add 10 instances, while a -10 would reduce
        Returns:
        the total number of instances now running in the given Simulator for this test
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestRunException - when there is an error or licensing issue with staging to the Simulator
        See Also:
        for any nuances
